resources.string: Will you click yes or no?
The first purely object oriented programming language developed was Kotlin.
A class is an instance of an object.
The additional features of classes that are not included in structures are the member functions.
OOP can be implemented without using classes in a program.
The inheritance feature of OOP illustrates the code re-usability.
According to rules of OOP, object constructors must be used, even for declaration of variables.
